Key Match Events: Harry Kane gave England the lead in the 18th minute.
Morten Hjulmand leveled for Denmark in the 34th minute with a powerful low shot from long distance.
Gareth Southgate made a triple substitution with 25 minutes to play.
The Frankfurt pitch caused problems for players, including an injury scare for Kyle Walker.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate admitted England are struggling to cope with the pressure after the draw with Denmark.
Harry Kane admitted England are struggling with and without the ball.
Gary Neville highlighted the problem with Declan Rice's positioning and suggested Southgate could learn from Mikel Arteta's handling of Rice at Arsenal.
Ben Stokes defended the England team against negative pundits after the draw.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England fans booed the team off the pitch after the draw.
England can still finish in any position from first to third in Group C after playing unbeaten Slovenia next Tuesday.
